abstracts.cdata!:
The principal objective of the
            Enterprise and Financial Sector Adjustment Loan Project is
            to support Hungary's efforts to implement effective
            reform of its enterprise and financial sectors. The loan
            will provide fast-disbursing funds for balance-of-payments
            assistance for the government's reform program. The
            government will aim to maintain a stable macroeconomic
            framework within which essential structural reforms can be
            implemented, especially those which will accelerate bank and
            enterprise privatization. The reform program's main
            components include: (1) an enterprise privatization program
            targeting substantial reduction of remaining State shares in
            enterprises, particularly in large utilities over the
            1995-97 period; (2) a strong program to curtail and reduce
            enterprise losses, and help free resources for projects of
            much higher returns; (3) comprehensive legal and regulatory
            development in the banking sector designed to preserve
            financial discipline and to ensure that scarce resources are
            effectively allocated to the most dynamic enterprises; and
            (4) radical improvement in bank governance in the context of
            a bank privatization program aimed at privatizing all
            remaining State-owned banks by 1997's end.
